context_of_use: This use case allows admins and power users to manage user accounts and perform bulk user-related operations within the system.
description: This use case enables admins and power users to manage user accounts and perform bulk user-related operations.
triggering_event: Admin or power user initiates user management actions.
preconditions: Admin or power user is logged into the system.
assumptions: The system has a user management interface.
requirements_met: The system shall allow admins to manage user accounts.
The system shall enable power users to handle bulk operations.
outstanding_issues: Clarification on specific bulk operations allowed for power users.
main_flow: 1. Admin → System: Admin selects user management option.
2. System → Admin: System displays user accounts.
3. Admin → System: Admin selects a user account to manage.
4. System → Admin: System displays user account details.
5. Admin → System: Admin updates user account information.
6. System → Admin: System confirms user account update.
7. Power user → System: Power user selects bulk operation option.
8. System → Power user: System displays bulk operation options.
9. Power user → System: Power user executes bulk operations.
10. System → Power user: System confirms completion of bulk operations.
